channel.title: The Unwritten on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in The Unwritten on jverkamp.com

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 7: The Wound
item.description:
So very bonkers. At times, I’m pretty sure I have no idea what’s going on, which makes me feel bad for the characters. :D It’s still a wonderful fever top of a story though.

Onward!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 6: Tommy Taylor and the War of Words
item.description:
The story is going now. Tommy has leaned into his powers–and his opponents are figuring out how to fight back!–we learn who/what exactly Pullman is, and Savoy really gets to do his Vampire thing.

Onward!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 5: On to Genesis
item.description:
Finding stories, history, … family? And more enemies, more powerful than ever.

It’s good, if a bit convoluted at times.

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 4: Leviathan
item.description:
Onward marches the story, ever stranger. Hints of what Tommy can (and must) do.

Onwards and upwards!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 3: Dead Man's Knock
item.description: He’s on the run and–eventually–starting to accept his destiny. It’s interesting to get further into who everyone is and how the world works. I’m curious where things will go next!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 2: Inside Man
item.description: Things are starting to move now! Prison, dedicated journalists, some real magic, and death. I’ll still trying to figure out the rules, but I’m enjoying it so far!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 1: Tommy Taylor and the Bogus Identity
item.description: Well that’s a start. A world where Tommy Taylor is a modern hidden world fantasy even bigger than Harry Potter… until the author disappears, leaving behind disillusioned son Tom Taylor. There are more than hints of a darker truth behind the story, hidden worlds within hidden worlds. And a section at the end establishing how far back in time the truth goes. So far, a fascinating sort of story. Well written and illustrated.
